moves.1. d4 d5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. h3: Dubious, but necessary to bring a place for the dsb in case of Nh5.
moves.3... Bf5 4. g4 Bg6: Good diag for the black lsb, but...
moves.7... Bxe5: Bad exchange for black, but he is already playing at my will.
moves.11... Bh7 12. g5: Black must be astonished. What am I doing, throwing my pawns before castling and even free the lsb?
moves.12... Nc6: Foresees to take advantage of e5 after the exchanges to come.
moves.13. gxh6 gxh6 14. Bxh6: Without fear: if Nxe5, Bg7, Nc5 (only one to save a piece), and maybe I still have an attack (Qxe4...)
moves.14... Rg8 15. f4: Delicate moment. Black can have counterplay with that column.
moves.15... Qd7 16. Bg5: Preventing him to castle, and blocking the column. Moreover: freeing the h pawn.
moves.16... Be4 17. Rh2: A key square for my rook, as you will see.
moves.17... Ne7: Blocking the dsb action so to castle.
moves.18. h6: I could have played Qb4 instead. But this threat is also good.
moves.18... O-O-O 19. Bf6: Guarantees a BxR exchange, at some point.
moves.19... Bh7: Better was d4, probably. This blocks the pawn, of course, so it's not bad.
moves.22. O-O-O: Anyway, e3 is on the "to do list".
moves.24. Qb4: No point in exchanging queens. I'm not sure this is the best square for it.
moves.24... Qc6: Now you can see the power of the Rh2.
moves.25. Bd3: Anyway, I must go on with the h pawn's threat.
moves.25... Bxd3 26. Rxd3 Rg1+: Probably, the best is Rd1, but I wanted to risk.
moves.28... Rg8g2+ 29. Rxg2 Rxg2+ 30. Ke1: The key. Now, I threat Qf8+ AND h8=Q+... Black can pursue me with Rg1+, Rf2, Qxc2+, KxR, but black doesn't have a perpetual due to the rook, the queen etc.
moves.30... Qxc2: The losing one. But what else?
moves.31. h8=Q+: He resigned here: Kd7, Qd8+, Kc6, Rc3+ wins the queen and the game.

gameName: GameKnot Blitz, the power of the London setting
